ncochran.controller

Class ChoiceController

  • java.lang.Object
    • ncochran.controller.ChoiceController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class ChoiceController
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    This class handles setting valid Choices based upon User input via text fields. Choices are valid if they are unique and not empty. Case is ignored.
    Author:
    Nigel Cochran

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
      This method is called when the user presses return in the text box and it then calls the runChoiceController method which performs the processing of this request.
      void runChoiceController()
      When the User presses return, this method records the text from the text box, checks to see if it is different from all other choices, then sets the choice and informs the user.

                int index)
        This method creates a ChoiceController.
        Parameters:
        event - DecisionLinesEvent The DecisionLinesEvent the controller will update
        gui - DecisionLinesGUI The Gui which contains text fields this controller can be associated with
        index - int The number associated with a JTextField in an array

    • Method Detail

      • runChoiceController

        public void runChoiceController()
        When the User presses return, this method records the text from the text box, checks to see if it is different from all other choices, then sets the choice and informs the user. If the choice is invalid (null or the same as another choice, then it clears the text field and the choice and informs the user.

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        This method is called when the user presses return in the text box and it then calls the runChoiceController method which performs the processing of this request.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
